headline: Blue Ribbon cites Curlee Discaya in contempt over lying about wife's absence
author: By LLANESCA T. PANTI, GMA Integrated News
content:
The Senate blue ribbon committee on Thursday cited contractor Pacifico "Curlee" Discaya II in contempt for lying about the absence of his wife, Sarah, during the probe into the anomalous government flood control projects.

The Blue Ribbon committee approved the motion put forward by Senator Raffy Tulfo to cite Curlee Discaya in contempt after he told the committee that his wife and business partner, Sarah, skipped the probe due to a "heart condition."

Senate Pro Tempore Panfilo Lacson, committee chairman, then read the letter sent by Sarah to the panel that she cannot attend due to a pre-scheduled meeting with her employees.

"Niloloko mo kami. You lied!" Senator Erwin Tulfo said.

Asked to explain his answer, Mr. Discaya said his wife also has diabetes and hypertension too.

"Marami po siyang maintenance na gamot na ginagamit," he said.

At this point, the Senate blue ribbon panel had enough and carried the motion to cite Mr. Discaya in contempt.—AOL, GMA Integrated News

column6: Valencia City under state of calamity due to flooding
column7: By CYRIL CHAVES, GMA Regional TV
column9:
Valencia City in Bukidnon has been placed under a state of calamity following a massive flooding that left four people dead.

The Valencia City Council declared the state of calamity afternoon on Friday, September 19, 2025.

According to data from the City Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Office (CDRRMO), the damage to properties reached more than P63 million.

Up to 83 houses were destroyed and more than 2,000 families were affected.

The local government said the declaration will allow them to use the calamity fund for disaster response efforts, including providing assistance to residents affected.

“Naa man ginatawag nga quick response fund sa balaod man gud sa RA 10121 not less than 5% sa revenue sa usa ka local government that will be allocated for disaster,” Valencia CDRRMO Training Division Head, Jovenone Ellacone, said.

As of 3:40 p.m. on Thursday, September 18, four bodies had been retrieved while four others remain missing.

“Kining upat nato nga patay naa’y katung maestro nga si sir Labay ga-edad sya og 53 dayun katung Viña nag-edad sya og 27, naay 13 ug naay 17. So estudyante ning 13 ug 17 mga estudyante ni sila,” Ellacone added.

Most of those who died and went missing were not able to escape the strong current.

In Purok 20, Poblacion, the pickup truck of one of the victims overturned and was swept away by the flood.

Floodwaters entered several houses and even reached above human height.

On Friday, floodwaters already subsided, allowing some evacuees to return home while others remained at the evacuation centers.

Personnel of the First Bukidnon Electric Cooperative, Inc. (FIBECO) and Valencia City Water District are also working to restore power and water in affected households. —GMA Regional TV

headline: 30 sectoral groups to join solidarity rally on Sept. 21, 2025
author: By ALAN DOMINGO, GMA Regional TV
content:
Various groups will stage a solidarity rally against corruption on Sunday, September 21, 2025 at the Plaza Independencia in Cebu City.

At least 30 sectoral groups pledged to participate in the rally to express their rage and frustration over deemed massive corruption in government, most glaring of which are the controversial flood control projects.

These groups are composed of vendors, farmers, drivers, students, among others.

In a media conference, representatives of the sectors signed a commitment for a unified call to fight corruption, to hold deemed “traitors” to the country accountable, and to seek their prosecution.

Juniño Padilla, lead convenor of Solidarity Rally Batok Kurapsyon, said that the rally is open to other members of society interested to participate. However, no political figure will be allowed to speak during the rally.

An estimated 5,000 individuals are expected to join the solidarity rally.

Padilla said the groups vowed to maintain peace and order while airing their grievances on September 21, 2025.

Meanwhile, the Cebu City Police Office (CCPO) assured the public they are fully prepared for the mass action on September 21, 2025 that coincides with the 53rd anniversary of the declaration of Martial Law.

It was learned from Police Captain Charisma Gonzales, CCPO spokesperson, that aside from the rally at the Plaza Independencia, another group will stage a protest at Fuente Osmeña. —GMA Regional TV
